metadata.name: Potential Suspicious Windows Feature Enabled
metadata.comment: Detects usage of the built-in PowerShell cmdlet "Enable-WindowsOptionalFeature" used as a Deployment Image Servicing and Management tool. Similar to DISM.exe, this cmdlet is used to enumerate, install, uninstall, configure, and update features and packages in Windows images

batch.sql: SELECT * FROM script_activity WHERE time BETWEEN CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() - INTERVAL 24 HOUR AND CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() AND (lower(activity_id) = lower('1') AND contains(lower(script.script_content.value), lower('enable-windowsoptionalfeature')) AND contains(lower(script.script_content.value), lower('-online')) AND contains(lower(script.script_content.value), lower('-featurename')) AND (contains(lower(script.script_content.value), lower('telnetserver')) OR contains(lower(script.script_content.value), lower('internet-explorer-optional-amd64')) OR contains(lower(script.script_content.value), lower('tftp')) OR contains(lower(script.script_content.value), lower('smb1protocol')) OR contains(lower(script.script_content.value), lower('client-projfs')) OR contains(lower(script.script_content.value), lower('microsoft-windows-subsystem-linux'))))

output.summary: Detects usage of the built-in PowerShell cmdlet "Enable-WindowsOptionalFeature" used as a Deployment Image Servicing and Management tool. Similar to DISM.exe, this cmdlet is used to enumerate, install, uninstall, configure, and update features and packages in Windows images

metadata.objective: False positive: Legitimate usage of the features listed in the rule. References: https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/powershell/module/dism/enable-windowsoptionalfeature?view=windowsserver2022-ps, https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/projfs/enabling-windows-projected-file-system, https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/wsl/install-on-server
